page.title: 13BROAD OAK
page.content: Broad Oak is a small village 3 miles up the hill north west of the city of Canterbury.It adjoins Sturry,and consists of a row of terraced council houses with a considerable amount of private housing that has been built in recent years. Two large residential caravan sites are situated on the edge of the village,some occupied for years by the same family! There are also three caravan and camping sites for tourists and holiday makers. There are several farms ,(about six) ,some of which produce fruit and corn as well as cattle ,geese and horses. One of the oldest houses in the village is a three hundred year old farm called Broad Oak . In its grounds is an old oak tree , which the village is currently named after , while the oldest house in Broad Oak , Mead Manor
